ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Help me with Settings
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree about the connection although I have used dialup when losing my ISP connection. That said,  EQ should run one at least something with these specs.
ygData.messageBody:
I agree about the connection although I have used
dialup when losing my ISP connection.

That said, EQ should run one at least something with
these specs.

1.5GHZ machine or better
512 MB of Ram 1GB preferred.
64MB video Card, certainly 128 or 256 is preferred but
I have run with a 64 and it ran fine.
56K modem but 90% will recommend a DSL or Cable modem.

Compare your machine against that and you should be
able to see where the lag is coming from.

But Please do check as Wulfric Mentioned because you
may also have your video hiked up when it should be
lower because of the machine.

Good Luck

Rob

--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:

> Heres the deal... on a dial up connection aint gonna
> be a whole heck of a lot you can do about lag. In
> the Display Options tab drop your Far clip Plane to
> nil. Change Opacity to nil. those two things will
> be your biggest help.
>
> Your computer has a built in graphics chip so not a
> lot of ways to change the video options on it.
>
> If virtual memory is low... do CTRL ALT DEL and end
> any processes in the background that are not
> necessary... for a new Compaq thats probably quite a
> bit.
>
> Add more memory. If possible, add a new video card.
> If possible, get DSL or cable.
>
> If all else fails, use the /viewport command.. The
> less area yoru graphics processor has to draw, the
> quicker it can draw it and the less lag you'll see.
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Alesia Howington
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com

>

> help and the tech support for my computer wont help.
>
> Here is what I do know
> Dial up internet 48.o Kbps
> most time connection is at
> Computer is a Compaq Presario Celeron Intel
> System Windows XP 2002
> Display Adapters Intel Graphic Controller
> Sound, video, and game controllers - Audio Codecs,
> Legacy Audio Drivers, Legacy Video Capture Devices,
> Media Control Devices, Realtek AC'97 Audio
>
> Most of the time I get crashed with the warning
> that the virtual memory is to low.
>
> Any and all advice Welcomed
>
> Cencodoria
